ayas.translation: In the Name of Allah, the All-beneficent, the All-merciful.
I swear by this town,
as you reside in this town;
[and] by the father and him whom he begot:
certainly We created man in travail.

ayas.arabic: أَيَحْسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقْدِرَ عَلَيْهِ أَحَدٌ
ayas.translation: Does he suppose that no one will ever have power over him?
He says, ‘I have squandered immense wealth.’
Does he suppose that no one sees him?
Have We not made for him two eyes,
a tongue, and two lips,
and shown him the two paths [of good and evil]?
Yet he has not embarked upon the uphill task.
And what will show you what is the uphill task?
[It is] the freeing of a slave,

ayas.arabic: أَوْ إِطْعَـٰمٌ فِى يَوْمٍ ذِى مَسْغَبَةٍ
ayas.translation: or feeding, during days of [general] starvation,
ayas.transliteration: aw iṭ`āmun fī yawmin dhī masghabah

ayas.translation: an orphan among relatives
or a needy man in desolation,

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلصَّبْرِ وَتَوَاصَوْا۟ بِٱلْمَرْحَمَةِ
ayas.translation: while being one of those who have faith and enjoin one another to patience, and enjoin one another to compassion.
ayas.transliteration: thumma kāna minal ladhīna āmanū watawāṣaw biṣ ṣabri watawāṣaw bil marḥamah

ayas.translation: They are the People of the Right Hand.

ayas.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا هُمْ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْمَشْـَٔمَةِ
ayas.translation: But those who defy Our signs, they are the People of the Left Hand.
ayas.transliteration: wal ladhīna kafarū bi-āyātinā hum aṣ-ḥābul mash-amah

ayas.translation: A closed Fire will be [imposed] upon them.
